method.name: PUT
method.doc: To unconfigure the runtime environment component of the appliance with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP PUT command on the runtime environment resource URI.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: operation
param.doc: This indicates what the update operation is. The value is always unconfigure.

param.name: ldap_dn
param.doc: The DN that is used when the system contacts the user registry. This field is required if user_registry is ldap.

param.name: ldap_pwd
param.doc: The password for the DN. if user_registry is ldap.

param.name: clean
param.doc: Whether the unconfigure operation removes all Security Verify Access domain, user, and group information. This field is optional if ps_mode is local. Otherwise this field is ignored. Valid values are "true" and "false".

param.name: force
param.doc: This option is used to force the unconfiguration if it is failing. For example, this happens when the LDAP server is corrupted. Valid values are "true" and "false".

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
